docs.lead_paragraph: International A3-11 U.S.-Honduras war games have begun involving 3,000 United States troops for four months, the armed forces announced. The exercise will include improving airstrips in the southern part of Honduras. Page A1 A U.S.-Soviet New Year's exchange of televised greetings from the two countries' leaders was rejected by Moscow, which cited what it called Washington's negative attitude on arms control issues. A6 Divestment's effect on South Africa is far more ambiguous than its advocates in the United States might have hoped. So far, the departures have tended to benefit the country's barons of corporate power.

docs.lead_paragraph: THE human brain converses with the entire universe, but it maintains a strange and stringent isolation from its own body. Many substances that circulate in the blood hardly enter the brain at all. Some chemicals in the brain will not diffuse outward into the general circulation. This strange selectivity is vital to the brain's proper function. But recently scientists have learned much about how to manipulate it to help the whole body fight disease.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: At a time when the Secretary of Health and Human Services proposes a Medicare catastrophic-care plan and New York's Governor Cuomo seeks legislation to subsidize the elderly's purchase of prescription drugs, an initiative proposed by the New York State Department of Social Services would reduce care available to indigent recipients of Medicare: the indigent elderly living in the community or in nursing homes, the indigent mentally retarded living in the community or in community care residences and the chronically disabled. The effect of the proposed regulation would be virtually to eliminate all co-insurance under Medicaid for all services provided under Medicare.

headline.main: Plan Would Curtail Psychiatric Care for Elderly
